title: Hugar
text:
Hugar (meaning "minds"; ) are an Icelandic <a href="Neo-classical%20music">neo-classical</a> <a href="post-rock">post-rock</a> duo, consisting of multi-instrumentalist composers <a href="Bergur%20%C3%9E%C3%B3risson">Bergur Þórisson</a> and Pétur Jónsson from <a href="Seltjarnarnes">Seltjarnarnes</a>, <a href="Iceland">Iceland</a>.
History.
Bergur and Pétur are childhood friends and started the band in 2012.
Hugar released their debut album, "Hugar", in 2014, featuring <a href="%C3%93lafur%20Arnalds">Ólafur Arnalds</a> playing drums. It was given out for free online. They signed with Sony and in 2019 their second album "Varða" was released on <a href="Sony%20Masterworks">Sony Masterworks</a>. 
The band performed at <a href="Iceland%20Airwaves">Iceland Airwaves</a> in 2017, 2018, and 2019. As of 2019 the band had 50 million plays on <a href="Spotify">Spotify</a>. Bergur and Pétur wrote the <a href="Film%20score">score</a> for the 2019 film "<a href="The%20Vasulka%20Effect">The Vasulka Effect</a>" about artists <a href="Steina%20and%20Woody%20Vasulka">Steina and Woody Vasulka</a>.
